New Records: Pete Alonso hit a game-winning three-run homer, his first home run in 12 games spanning the postseason and regular season.
Jose Quintana pitched six scoreless innings for the Mets.
Key Match Events: Pete Alonso's ninth-inning three-run homer was the game-winning hit.
The Mets defeated the Brewers in the NL Wild Card game.
Pre-Game Insights: Francisco Lindor expressed confidence in Pete Alonso's ability to have his moment in the game.
Post-Match Reflections: The Mets secured their NL Wild Card victory, advancing to the next round of the playoffs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game marked Pete Alonso's first home run in 12 games, making it a memorable moment.
